title: Jamaican Officials Worry That Not Enough People Are Evacuating Ahead of Melissa
summary: As Hurricane Melissa barrels toward the island nation, only a fraction of residents have headed to evacuation centers.

title: Beyond Trade War, China’s Xi Looks to Press Trump on Taiwan
summary: China’s leader wants to weaken American support for Taiwan. But first he will want clarity about President Trump’s stance toward the island.

title: Trump’s China Deal May Avert a Crisis of His Own Making
summary: The Trump administration is hailing a potential deal that may return the U.S.-China relationship to where it was before the president began a trade war against Beijing.

title: Bill Gates Says Climate Change ‘Will Not Lead to Humanity’s Demise’
summary: In a memo, the Microsoft co-founder warned against a “doomsday outlook” and appears to have shifted some of his views about climate change.

title: Jeremy Allen White and the Anxiety of Playing Springsteen
summary: The star never imagined he’d be performing as the Boss in front of the Boss. But the head-spinning nature of the role has paid off.

title: AFGE, Top Federal Workers’ Union, Sides With Republicans on Shutdown
summary: The American Federation of Government Employees, in a shift, called on Congress to immediately reopen the government without the health care measures sought by Democratic lawmakers.

title: Government Shutdown Imperils SNAP and Other Antipoverty Programs
summary: Within days, tens of millions of low-income Americans may lose assistance for food, child care and utilities if the federal government remains shut down.

title: Trump Argues in Formal Appeal That His Conviction Was ‘Fatally Marred’
summary: In 2024, a jury found that Donald J. Trump approved a scheme to falsify business records to conceal a hush-money payment to a porn star. He became the first felon president.

title: Trump Keeps Musing About a 3rd Term Despite Constitutional Limits
summary: A president who has chafed at the limits on his power sees political benefit in talking about remaining in office.

title: Milei’s Win in Argentina Signals Rebuke of the Past and Trump’s Impact
summary: President Javier Milei emerged from the election with an even tighter bond with the United States and a bigger mandate to pass transformative economic plans.

title: Why America’s Debate Over Which Children Are ‘Gifted’ Won’t Go Away
summary: Gifted programs could be shutting out millions of high-performing Black and Latino children from low-income families. Can districts fix their advanced education problem?

title: At Mamdani Rally, a Moment of Unity Goes Sideways for Hochul
summary: Gov. Kathy Hochul received a tepid response from a stadium filled with Zohran Mamdani supporters, whose chants of “Tax the rich” interrupted her speech.

title: A New Era of Strongman Rulers Has Begun
summary: The meeting in South Korea will be between two powerful men who govern by impulse, not institutions — and that’s dangerous.

title: The Insidious Joviality of Nigel Farage
summary: His rise is both a symptom and a cause of the newly febrile mood in Britain.

title: The Harvard Salient Invoked Hitler. Now It Has Been Suspended.
summary: The Harvard Salient, a conservative outlet, used a phrase that was similar to a speech given by Hitler. Its independent board paused its operations over material it called “reprehensible, abusive and demeaning.”

title: Jack DeJohnette, Revered Jazz Drummer, Dies at 83
summary: Endowed with spectacular range, he played with Miles Davis, led New Directions and Special Edition, and spent decades with Keith Jarrett’s Standards Trio.

title: Which Is Better, One Long Walk or Many Short Ones?
summary: A new analysis is one of the first to study whether spacing steps out or consolidating them was linked to better health outcomes.
